@gr2m you create a new session not overwrite the one existing session.
But Sessions are not HATEOAS so both should be avoided.

@gr2m HATEOAS means not clients state on the server side.
This sums up my idea about POST vs. PUT: https://t.co/ANuc6BG9da

@gr2m you can create resources with GET, too. 
There is no exact recipe. Make an API far, simple to use and consistent, that's important.
@gr2m So your session ID is "session"?!
@gr2m yes, right. It's not an actual resource, but a virtual one. Like /login. I still would use POST.
